title: Director GTM Analytics and Planning
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

We are seeking a strategic and visionary Director of GTM Analytics & Planning to lead the development and execution of our GTM analytics strategy. This role is pivotal in accelerating revenue growth, optimizing GTM performance, and empowering cross-functional stakeholders with actionable insights. You will develop a high-performing analytics team and partner with Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Corporate Strategy and Finance to define performance metrics and guide strategic initiatives.

As a senior leader within Revenue Operations, your insights will power decision-making at the highest levels, influence how we grow and retain customers, and ensure alignment across our GTM ecosystem. If you are passionate about transforming data into strategy and thrive in a high-impact, fast-paced environment, we’d love to hear from you.

What You’ll Do: 

Strategic Leadership & Planning

  • Lead the annual GTM planning process in partnership with Sales, Marketing, Finance, and Corporate Strategy.
  • Build business cases for growth initiatives (e.g., segment expansion, territory & quota design, headcount allocation).
  • Define, standardize, and evolve GTM KPIs; maintain a centralized performance metrics framework.

Analytics & Reporting

  • Architect and operationalize a scalable analytics framework to evaluate GTM performance, market trends, and customer behavior.
  • Manage the design, development, and enhancement of GTM dashboards, reports, and self-service BI tools.
  • Run the CRO reporting cadence, delivering timely & actionable insights aligned with business goals.
  • Own the CRO forecasting operating rhythm to ensure predictable results.

Team & Stakeholder Management

  • Build and mentor a team of analysts and revenue operations business partners across global locations.
  • Act as a strategic partner to Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Finance and Corporate Strategy leaders.
  • Foster a culture of data-driven decision-making throughout the GTM organization.

Data Governance & Infrastructure

  • Ensure data accuracy, integrity, integration and availability across all GTM systems and analytics environments.
  • Develop and implement best practices for data governance, analytics methodology, and reporting.

Innovation & Enablement

  • Champion the adoption of advanced analytics tools and visualization platforms.
  • Lead the design of a scalable self-service analytics environment to empower non-technical users.
  • Present data-driven narratives to executive stakeholders, influencing top-level strategy.

What You’ll Bring

  • Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s degree in Analytics, Business, Economics, or related field strongly preferred.
  • 7–10+ years of experience in analytics, revenue operations, business intelligence, or strategic planning roles, ideally within high-growth B2B or SaaS environments.
  • Proven experience leading cross-functional analytics teams and building analytics strategies that directly impact revenue growth.
  • Deep understanding of GTM analytics, including sales funnel analysis, marketing attribution, pipeline health, and customer retention metrics.
  • Strong knowledge of SaaS-based territory and quota management processes and sales compensation structures.
  • Technical proficiency in SQL, Excel, and one or more scripting languages (Python/R); advanced experience with BI and data visualization tools (e.g., Domo, Clari, Tableau).
  • Familiarity with CRM, marketing automation, and customer success platforms (e.g., Salesforce, Marketo, Gainsight).
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to distill complex analytics into clear business recommendations.
  • Strategic thinker with a track record of influencing senior stakeholders and aligning analytics with organizational goals.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience managing analytics and forecasting for Revenue Operations or GTM Strategy in SaaS companies.
  • Background in consulting, finance, equity research, or strategic planning is highly valued.
  • Expertise in business modeling, scenario analysis, and balanced scorecard development.

Demonstrated success in driving adoption of analytics tools and establishing data-driven cultures.

title: Don't see what you're looking for?  Join our Talent Network! (Data Engineering)
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

Are you a skilled Data Engineer with a passion for Python, ETL Pipelines, and Web Scraping? We plan on hiring in the near future and we want to hear from you! By joining our Talent Network and submitting your application, we can keep you updated when a suitable position becomes available.

About Recorded Future

Recorded Future is the world’s largest provider of intelligence for enterprise security. By combining persistent and pervasive automated data collection and analytics with human analysis, Recorded Future delivers intelligence that is timely, accurate, and actionable. Recorded Future is trusted by over 1,600 businesses and government organizations around the world.

About The Data Engineering Teams

Source Collections: We harvest data from over a million outside external sources (dark web, open source, technical sources, etc.). We do so by setting up robust data pipelines, using scraping technologies, and writing APIs.

Structured Data: We manage all technical cyber security data processing and analysis of structured data which represent direct output from our pipelines to our clients.

Data Curation and Quality: We turn data from the Source Collections and Structured Data teams into knowledge graphs that give customers critical security insights and actionable intelligence.

About Our Tech Stack: Python, Selenium, Beautifulsoup, AWS, Redshift, Jupyter, Flask, React, Dask, Git, Mongo, ElasticSearch, RabbitMQ,, Word2vec, Sckikit-learn, Fasttext, Spacy, Sentry, Kibana, Grafana, Prefect, InfluxDB

title: Lead Software Engineer, Malware Intelligence
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

We are looking for an outstanding Lead Software Engineer with diverse skills and a strong interest in driving technical excellence with the team to join Recorded Future’s Malware Intelligence Team within the R&D organization. You will join a group of talented engineers in a dynamic environment where challenging requirements, sharing knowledge, and supporting our company vision are integral to success. We work with Security Intelligence Solutions, which our clients use to stay on top of threats to their business. Within our platform, we serve many different types of data. Our platform cuts through the noise and surfaces relevant and actionable data to search and analyze the data, create alerts, prioritize, and process the intelligence. The Malware Intelligence Team is responsible for building and continuously improving the Malware Intelligence processing pipeline and web application constructed atop our immense dataset from other parts of the organization.

Our product team consists of Data Scientists, Backend and Frontend developers, Product Managers, Designers, and QA professionals collaborating to create efficient products.

You would get the chance to develop great software in a fast-moving environment close to our global clients and their needs. Together, we’ll improve our product to meet increasing demands while focusing on scalability and quality. You will also experiment with new technology and explore what solutions are most suitable for solving real-world problems. You would join a dynamic team eager to take on new challenges and passionate about what they do.

What you will be doing:

  • Lead and own the design, development, and optimization of large-scale data pipelines that process and analyze malware samples.
  • Optimize feature extraction, high-volume cloud, ETL processes, storage solutions, and real-time data streaming for scalability and reliability.
  • You will work closely with our internal researchers, data scientists, and platform engineers to ensure efficient data ingestion, enrichment, and correlation to enhance threat detection and response.
  • Continuously design, develop, and deploy features with a focus on high availability, great quality, low latency, and scalability
  • Work with threat intelligence feeds, sandbox reports, and different threat detection rules’ formats to enrich malware detection
  • Select optimal methods and techniques for obtaining solutions alongside technical coordination of efforts within the Product Team
  • Measure and evaluate features and system metrics to improve quality and service performance.
  • Implement automation for data collection, analysis, and alerting to reduce manual effort.
  • Network with key contacts outside the area of expertise
  • Proactive, goes beyond expectations, independent, self-driven

What you will need:

  • Minimum of 10 years of experience as a software engineer, preferably in technical lead roles
  • Strong experience in Python, Scala, or Java for backend development
  • Proficiency in distributed computing frameworks (Spark, Kafka, Flink) and AWS cloud services
  • Experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and CI/CD pipelines for deployment automation
  • Architected and developed solutions to ambiguous problems with significant impact
  • Lead high-level discussions on technology strategy and approach
  • Hands-on experience in building real-time systems, preferably threat detection, with the ability to analyze complex security data and develop efficient solutions
  • Experience in working in agile teams, collaborating with other teams and subject areas to deliver software from MVP phase to full-scale
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively advocate technical solutions to product, engineering, and business audiences
  • Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent education/work experience
  • Strong English communication skills are a must

title: Manager, Business Development EMEA
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

About Recorded Future

At Recorded Future, we’re on a mission to empower organisations to disrupt adversaries with intelligence. As the world’s largest intelligence company, our platform delivers accurate and actionable insights at the speed and scale needed to reduce risk and drive confident security decisions. We serve more than 1,600 businesses and government organisations around the globe, including over 45 of the Fortune 100.

We’re proud to be a team of over 900 Futurists, representing more than 40 nationalities, who live our core values of high standards, inclusion, and ethical action. Join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity.

The Role

We are seeking a dynamic and hands-on Manager, EMEA Business Development to lead and grow our high-performing BDR team across London and the wider EMEA region. This is a strategic leadership role that blends coaching, data-driven decision-making, and collaboration across Sales, Marketing, and Product teams.

You will be responsible for building a culture of performance and accountability, ensuring lead generation efforts are aligned with sales goals, and supporting career development for a distributed team of Business Development Representatives.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead, manage, and coach a team of up to 10 BDRs based in London and remotely across EMEA.
  • Drive both inbound and outbound pipeline generation, with a hands-on approach to outreach and meeting setting.
  • Hire, onboard, and develop new BDRs in partnership with Sales Enablement.
  • Establish clear metrics and KPIs for success, and deliver weekly analysis and quarterly performance reviews.
  • Build a strong coaching and mentoring culture, with regular 1:1s and ongoing skills development.
  • Maintain data hygiene and accuracy in Salesforce, ensuring transparency of pipeline and conversion rates.
  • Collaborate closely with Marketing and Sales to optimise lead handover and qualification processes.
  • Track BDR performance trends using sales enablement tools and adjust strategies accordingly.
  • Design and manage performance incentive plans to drive engagement and motivation.
  • Foster a collaborative and inclusive team culture that celebrates wins and learns from losses.

What You’ll Bring

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
  • Proven leadership experience, ideally managing BDR or SDR teams in a SaaS or cybersecurity environment.
  • 2–3+ years’ experience in a BDR, SDR, or Inside Sales role – experience with public sector clients is a plus.
  • Strong working knowledge of Salesforce and sales enablement tools (e.g. Outreach, Salesloft, Gong).
  • A data-driven mindset with the ability to interpret performance metrics and optimise accordingly.
  • A passion for coaching, developing talent, and creating a high-performance sales culture.
  • Experience or strong interest in the information security and threat intelligence landscape.

title: Manager, Data Engineering
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

Manager, Data Engineering - Graph Quality 

Recorded Future combats cyber security threats by delivering actionable intelligence from the Security Intelligence Graph. The Graph Quality team aggregates data from various sources and Indicators of Compromise (IOCs) to ensure that risk is properly attributed in the defender space graph. 

What You'll Do: 

  • Manage a team of 3-4 developers 
  • Mentor the team, plan team goals, and lead Agile scrum meetings to ensure that engineering deliverables are completed in a timely manner, with high quality
  • Develop data pipelines to analyze and ingest data at scale
  • Identify, scope, and own technical solutions to drive the successful execution of projects
  • Create technical project plans and drive the successful execution of projects, with input from our Product team and other developers on your team
  • Collaborate with Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and business leaders to scope and implement technical solutions 

What You'll Bring: 

  • 4+ years of previous team leadership experience 
  • 5+ years of programming and experience in Data Science, including 1+ years of experience with Python programming
  • 3+ years of experience with cloud computing tools, e.g. from AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
  • 1+ years of experience managing or leading a team
  • Experience writing scalable, production-grade applications and ETL/ELT pipelines
  • Efficient & accurate problem solving skills, including the ability to debug both software and data

  • Proven success in delivering projects from design and implementation to release
  • Excellent attention to detail & ability to work independently while delivering high-quality results
  • Excellent written & verbal communication when collaborating with colleagues across various locations and timezones, designing technical approaches, and writing documentation

title: Manager, Data Engineering (Data Collection)
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

Engineering Manager, Dark Web: 

Recorded Future collects intelligence from many sources on the Dark Web. This data collection includes terabytes of data dumps that are shared and trafficked in the underground, nefarious dark web forums, markets for stolen goods, and ransomware sites. The Dark Web team builds the data collection and analytics that transform this mass of raw data from these diverse sources into structured intelligence that our customers use to defend their people and networks. 

The Engineering Manager, Dark Web is responsible for coordinating the work of the engineers who produce a constant stream of fresh, high-fidelity analytics derived from unreliable dark web and underground data sources that enable clients to track threat actors and take security actions.

Your leadership will directly impact the success of the Dark Web team’s mission: to secure the world with intelligence by casting a light upon the dark web.

What You'll Do: 

  • Deliver customer value by producing data and analytics that summarize  information from the Dark Web and drive the alerting that our customers directly consume.
  • Lead, mentor, and develop a diverse team of six engineers focused on Dark Web data collection and analysis, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement.
  • Coordinate and oversee the development and maintenance of web harvesting and data processing applications and pipelines, ensuring they meet organizational and client needs.
  • Partner with the Product Manager, Dark Web to manage project timelines and deliverables in an often high-pressure context, maintaining focus on both short-term objectives and long-term strategic goals.
  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including cybersecurity researchers and other engineering units, to refine intelligence analytics and enhance product offerings.
  • Address and resolve elevated client escalations with a focus on maintaining relationships while delivering prompt and effective solutions.
  • A solid understanding of cybersecurity, along with an interest in analyzing dark web activities related to computer and network security.

What You'll Bring: 

  • Significant experience in engineering management or leadership roles, particularly within data engineering or analytics teams, demonstrating a track record of success in high-pressure environments.
  • Strong capability in managing and guiding remote or hybrid teams, utilizing effective communication and collaboration tools to maintain team cohesion and productivity.
  • Understanding of Python, relevant database technologies and fundamental programming and data engineering concepts
  • Exceptional organizational skills, capable of turning complex requirements into actionable project plans and fostering incremental delivery within a software development framework.
  • Excellent communication skills, adept at conveying complex technical concepts in a clear and concise manner through various channels including emails, Slack, and in-person discussions.

title: Product Learning Experience Designer
description_text:

title: Product Marketing Manager, LATAM
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

We are seeking a results-driven Product Marketing Manager to lead go-to-market initiatives across LATAM. This role will drive product adoption, execute digital marketing campaigns, and enable sales teams to succeed in the LATAM market.

title: Product Support Analyst
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

(Japanese description follows English) (日本語の説明は英語の後に続きます）

The Product Support Analyst role is part of our Global Intelligence Services group, driving problem solving, product bug escalations, and threat intelligence solutions support.

You’ll be responsible for resolving client inquiries stemming from Recorded Future’s application portal and API, as well as providing guidance on product functionality.  At the same time, you’ll occasionally be asked to get your hands dirty supporting installation and operational issues for our customers that are using our various APIs, and partner integrations.  The working hours for this role will be during APJ business hours (9am - 5pm JST), where you will be primarily supporting our Japanese and Asia Pacific clients during their regular business hours, as well as off hours requests from our U.S. or European/META clients, out of our Tokyo, Japan office.

We’re looking for a candidate with:

  • Experience as a problem-solving expert handling security technology and products.
  • Experience occasionally mentoring less senior/more junior support groups, and adding centralized knowledge base solutions to assist the overall group in incident resolution
  • A strong technical foundation in security and intelligence principles, as well as Saas platforms
  • Passion for being out in the field working with both security professionals and business stakeholders to support cyber threat intelligence solutions and services.
  • The hunger and drive to succeed in a startup environment

Responsibilities:

  • Front and back-end support of the Recorded Future web application interface, and API endpoints
  • Provide explanations of certain product feature functionality, as well guide clients on how to find solutions in our platform
  • Support deployments of Recorded Future Threat Intelligence data in customer environments, including SIEMs, ticketing systems, incident response tools, and SOAR products.
  • Support productized integration solutions across a variety of enterprise security architectures, applications, and tools.
  • Work with our Product and Development teams in escalation of incidents as well as assisting with advocating for product enhancements on the client’s behalf
  • Manage multiple projects and tasks in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
  • Work live APJ business. hours (9am - 5pm JST)
  • Participate in on-call rotation to help with emergency off-hours support coverage

Qualifications

  • Native level Japanese language, and business-level English language required
  • Minimum of 3 years experience working in the Japanese IT/Saas industry
  • 2+ years experience in a Saas / Product Support role, with threat intelligence / cyber security familiarity preferred
  • You will have been providing extensive product support to end customers in a SaaS platform, with the ability to diagnose and address challenging application issues. The ability and experience of working independently and proactively is key
  • Adequate work experience in information security, Cybersecurity, or Security Operations
  • Demonstrated skills in speaking technically and effectively with customers, analysts, and developers
  • Solid foundation in basic network and internet protocols
  • A+ / Network+ / Security+/ HDI-CSR certifications preferred
  • Experience with SIEMs (Splunk, QRadar, LogRhythm) and other security tools (TIPs, Vulnerability Management, Security Orchestration and Automation) is a plus.
  • Experience with REST APIs and JSON is a plus 
  • Experience utilizing ticket systems and associated workflows (Zendesk and JIRA is a plus)
  • Ability to work independently and proactively
  • Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills

 

未来を共に切り拓きませんか？

ウェブ上の洞察を抽出する当社の革新的な能力は、インテリジェンスとサイバー脅威の可視化を飛躍的に向上させています。当社は、スピード感がありエネルギーに溢れる急成長中の企業です。進化し続けるプロダクトやテクノロジーに柔軟に対応しながら、お客様と密接に連携して取り組んでいます。経験豊富な経営陣と世界有数の投資家による強力な支援体制のもとで働くことができます。

 

シニアプロダクトサポートアナリストの役割は、グローバルインテリジェンスサービス部門の一員として、問題解決、製品バグのエスカレーション、脅威インテリジェンスソリューションのサポートを推進します。

 

Recorded FutureのアプリケーションポータルやAPIに関連するお客様からの問い合わせを解決し、製品機能に関するガイダンスを提供します。

また、当社の各種APIやパートナー製品との連携機能をご利用中のお客様に対してインストールや運用上の関する技術支援を実施し、必要に応じて実作業を伴う対応も行います。

本ポジションの勤務時間はAPJ（アジア太平洋）地域の標準営業日（日本時間9時〜17時）となり、東京オフィスを拠点に、APJ地域のお客様への対応が主な業務となります。併せて、米国および欧州・中東・アフリカ（EMEA）地域のお客様からの時間外リクエストにも対応します。

 

求める人物像：

  • セキュリティ技術および製品に関する問題解決の専門家としての経験
  • より経験の浅いサポートチームへのメンタリング経験、およびインシデント解決を支援するためのナレッジベースの構築経験
  • セキュリティとインテリジェンスの原則、およびSaaSプラットフォームに関する堅固な技術的基盤
  • セキュリティ専門家やビジネスステークホルダーと協力し、サイバー脅威インテリジェンスソリューションおよびサービスの支援に情熱を持つこと
  • スタートアップ環境で成功するための意欲と推進力

 

職務内容：

  • Recorded Future ウェブアプリケーションインターフェースおよびAPIエンドポイントのフロントエンドとバックエンドサポート
  • 特定の製品機能の動作説明を提供し、顧客がプラットフォーム内で解決策を見つけるための支援を行う
  • SIEM、チケッティングシステム、インシデントレスポンスツール、SOAR製品などの顧客環境に対するRecorded Future 脅威インテリジェンスデータの展開をサポート
  • 多様なエンタープライズセキュリティアーキテクチャ、アプリケーション、ツールにおける製品統合ソリューションのサポート
  • 製品チームおよび開発チームと連携し、インシデントのエスカレーション対応および顧客要望に基づく機能改善提案を実施
  • ダイナミックかつ迅速な環境下で複数プロジェクト・タスクを管理
  • APJ 地域の標準営業時間（日本時間 9:00～17:00）で勤務
  • 緊急時の時間外サポートに対応するオンコールローテーションに参加

 

必要な経験・知識：

  • 日本語ネイティブレベル、ビジネスレベルの英語力
  • 日本国内のIT/SaaS業界での3年以上の実務経験
  • SaaS/製品サポート業務経験 2年以上（脅威インテリジェンスやサイバーセキュリティの知識あれば尚可）
  • SaaSプラットフォームにおけるエンドユーザーに対する豊富な製品サポート経験および、複雑なアプリケーション障害の診断・対応能力
  • エンドユーザー向け SaaS プラットフォームにおける豊富な製品サポート経験と、複雑なアプリケーション障害の診断・対応能力。自主的かつ主体的に業務を推進できること
  • 情報セキュリティ、サイバーセキュリティ、またはセキュリティオペレーションにおける十分な実務経験
  • 顧客、アナリスト、開発者との技術的なコミュニケーション能力
  • ネットワークおよびインターネットプロトコルに関する基礎知識の確かな理解
  • A+ / Network+ / Security+/ HDI-CSR認定資格が望ましい
  • SIEM（Splunk、QRadar、LogRhythm）およびその他のセキュリティツール（TIPs、脆弱性管理、SOAR等）の経験があれば尚可
  • REST API および JSON の使用経験があれば尚可
  • チケットシステムと関連ワークフローの活用経験（ZendeskおよびJIRAの経験があれば尚可）
  • 独立して積極的に業務を遂行できる能力
  • 高い問題解決能力およびトラブルシューティングスキル

title: Senior Data Engineer
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

Senior Data Engineer, Dark Web: 

Recorded Future collects intelligence from many sources on the Dark Web. This data collection includes terabytes of data dumps that are shared and trafficked in the underground, nefarious dark web forums, markets for stolen goods, and most notably — ransomware sites. 

The Ransomware squad on the Dark Web team builds the data collection and analytics that transform this mass of raw data from ransomware blogs into structured intelligence that our customers use to defend their people and networks. 

The Senior Data Engineer, Dark Web will work on producing a constant stream of fresh, high-fidelity analytics derived from unreliable dark web and underground data sources that enable clients to track threat actors and take security actions. Your contribution will directly impact the success of the Dark Web team’s mission: to secure the world with intelligence by casting a light upon the dark web

What You'll Do:   

  • Build, maintain, monitor and Collect data from hard-to-reach dark web sites and ransomware blogs.
  • Own the reliability of the automatic processing of this structured raw data. Investigate and resolve data processing problems by improving our data processing code so it will automatically handle similar scenarios in the future.
  • Maintain and improve our data ingestion pipeline that processes and indexes metadata from large files. This includes analytic-generation services that use NLP to extract content with the highest security value.
  • Lead by example when architecting, collaborating and delivering new and improved solutions.

What You'll Bring :

  • 5+ years experience with Python working in a professional software engineering environment that involves thorough code testing and review processes
  • Strong problem solving capabilities and experience troubleshooting data issues within your own processes and those of your peers.
  • 5+ years experience maintaining production-ready, efficient data engineering pipelines and systems with extensive monitoring to accommodate complex data ingestion problems

  • 2+ years of experience with cloud computing tools, e.g. from AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud

  • Familiarity with any of the following: message buses (e.g. Kafka, RabbitMQ), NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB, AWS Neptune, Neo4j), ElasticSearch

  • Exposure to ML approaches, including experience productizing ML models

title: Senior Field Marketing Manager
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

The role: You’ll develop and execute the marketing strategy in collaboration with sales leadership to establish a plan to exceed pipeline targets. You’ll roll-out inbound and outbound demand generation and pipeline acceleration programs across the North America region – including events, integrated digital campaigns, paid advertising programs, account-based marketing, lead nurturing, thru-partner campaigns, and customer advocacy activities.

What You'll Do as Sr. Field Marketing Manager: 

  • Set regional field marketing strategy in partnership with sales and channel teams
  • Create demand through various marketing tactics including integrated campaigns, conferences and local events, account-based marketing (ABM) programs, industry-specific campaigns, joint channel and tech alliance marketing activities, and more
  • Monitor and report on campaign results and effectiveness, including ROI, and recommend changes as needed
  • Collaborate and optimize communication with with Corporate/Product Marketing and Demand Generation on successful strategies for increasing event participation, revenue growth, and community awareness
  • Ensure that content is aligned with corporate go-to-market messaging and positioning
  • Work closely with partnership teams to identify and cultivate partner relationships. Execute on general event logistics as needed (venue search, marketing invites, staffing, onsite coordination, etc.)
  • Manage prospect lists between the company's CRM and marketing automation databases and vendors' progress (export and import)
  • Manage vendors assisting with demand generation such as content syndication groups, graphic designers, fulfillment agencies
  • Coordinate initiatives across internal teams and vendors
  • Provide regional assistance to marketing initiatives as required
  • Provide feedback to relevant stakeholders based on sales and prospect feedback

What You'll Bring as The Sr. Field Marketing Manager: 

  • 5+ years experience in field or similar marketing role, cybersecurity experience preferred
  • Proven ability to plan and execute strategic campaigns
  • Strong communication skills, able to build and maintain relationships
  • Self motivated, proactive thinker
  • Strong team player, with the ability to work with multiple stakeholders
  • Demonstrated analytical, organizational, negotiation, and project management skills
  • Willing to travel (~20 - 30%)
  • SFDC, HubSpot knowledge a plus

title: Senior Intelligence Consultant, Ukraine
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

Summary

The Senior Intelligence Consultant role supports Ukrainian clients in the public and private sectors, focusing on technical implementation and customer success. Responsibilities include onboarding and configuring the Recorded Future platform, addressing client intelligence needs, and advancing client security programs. The role involves tight deadlines, senior leadership communication, event representation, and delivering measurable client success.

Key Responsibilities

Technical Engagements & Training (65%)

  • Deploy client projects such as workshops, advanced training, and intelligence requirement development.
  • Master and adapt Recorded Future products for diverse audiences.
  • Manage project tracking via ticketing dashboards and customer management tools.
  • Provide ad hoc technical troubleshooting and continuously improve engagement methodologies.

Relationship Building (15%)

  • Build and maintain relationships with client teams and leadership.
  • Serve as the on-the-ground representative for Recorded Future in Ukraine.
  • Map stakeholder networks and share insights internally.

Material Creation (10%)

  • Create and share resources such as threat updates, intelligence kits, playbooks, and vulnerability reports.
  • Enable rapid deployment of platform features for intelligence-driven security programs.

Event Support (10%)

  • Lead presentations, workshops, and webinars at industry events and user groups.
  • Support company thought leadership efforts.

Additional Contributions

  • Collaborate with data science and product teams to refine platform ontologies and alerting.
  • Offer feedback to improve product modules and integrations.
  • Support third-party integrations (TIPs, SOARs, SIEMs) with foundational troubleshooting.
  • Manage platform users and API keys, ensuring deployment tracking accuracy.

Preferred Background

  • Experience with government or critical national infrastructure organizations.
  • Strong understanding of nation-state and criminal cyber threats.
  • Proven ability to communicate with senior leadership and operational teams.
  • Skilled in stakeholder mapping and mission alignment.

Qualifications & Experience

  • Required: Fluency in English and Ukrainian; confidence in SaaS security platforms; proactive and inquisitive mindset.
  • Highly Desired:
    • Security experience with threat intelligence or infosec.
    • Client-facing consultative or customer success roles.
    • Strong troubleshooting, presentation, and interpersonal skills.

title: Senior Project Manager, Technology Integrations
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

Senior Project Manager – Technology Integrations 

Reports to: VP Integration Executive, Recorded Future 

About the Role

Recorded Future is seeking a Senior Project Manager to lead and coordinate the Technology Track of Mastercard’s acquisition of Recorded Future. This highly strategic role sits at the intersection of technology, business strategy, and M&A execution, covering the full lifecycle from technical due diligence to integration delivery. You’ll help shape and implement the integration strategy that enables synergies, ensures compliance with Mastercard’s operational and security standards, and drives long-term value.

This position demands a collaborative leader who can work cross-functionally across engineering, product, security, infrastructure, enterprise IT, and executive stakeholders from both Mastercard and Recorded Future.

What You’ll Do: 

  • Lead the Technology Integration Track at Recorded Future, encompassing Business and Product Security, Product Infrastructure and Architecture, Business IT and related domains
  • Support technology assessment, working with SMEs to assess organizational maturity, processes, tools, infrastructure, SDLC, security posture, and technical architecture and adherence to Mastercard compliance requirements and standards. 
  • Assess and prioritize actions needed to be implemented within the Recorded Future technology track to reach the overarching integration objectives. 
  • Build out a plan together with the Integration project team and Mastercard counterparts. 
  • Evaluate risks, issues, synergies, and opportunities, and summarize findings into actionable insights and recommendations.
  • Manage project health by proactively identifying risks, resolving conflicts, and ensuring milestones are met.
  • Coordinate with other integration tracks, teams and integration Project Managers to resolve dependencies and priorities. 
  • Work hands-on with tools like Jira, Confluence, and other project/release tracking systems to ensure visibility and accountability.
  • Serve as a key liaison across technical and business teams, ensuring alignment on priorities, goals, and execution plans.
  • Deliver clear and frequent reporting to integration executives, tech leads, and corporate development teams.

What You’ll Bring 

  • 7+ years in technology project/program management, ideally with experience in M&A or post-merger integrations.
  • Demonstrated success managing complex, global technology integrations across Security, IT, software, infrastructure, and cybersecurity domains.
  • Strong technical acumen with the ability to understand architectural concepts, development methodologies, and operational IT systems.
  • Experience leading cross-functional teams and coordinating with multiple stakeholders, including senior executives.
  • Exceptional communication and organizational skills, with the ability to bring clarity and structure to high-pressure initiatives.
  • Fluent in English and experienced in working with global teams.
  • Familiarity with Agile/SAFe, ITIL, ITSM, or enterprise IT governance frameworks.
  • Exposure to business process modeling and enterprise architecture strategy.

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field.

title: Senior Threat Intelligence Analyst (China Focus)
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

Senior Threat Intelligence Analyst (China Focus)

Strategic and Persistent Threats, Insikt Group, Recorded Future

 

This Role:

As a Senior Threat Intelligence Analyst on Insikt Group’s Strategic and Persistent Threats (SPT) team, you will lead efforts to track state-sponsored APT campaigns, mentor peers in intrusion analysis, represent Insikt Group’s expertise externally, and support Recorded Future’s Analyst-on-Demand service.

This role involves both proactive monitoring and in-depth research into threat actor infrastructure, tools, and TTPs, as well as the production of high-impact, client-driven finished intelligence. Your focus will be on state-sponsored cyber threats originating from China.

What You’ll Do: 

  • Conduct proactive research on state-sponsored APT activity by synthesizing multiple technical datasets to develop novel insights and high-quality reporting
  • Establish and refine methods to track APT campaigns using network, intrusion, and malware analysis
  • Hunt for threat actor infrastructure and activity across diverse technical data sources, leveraging banner data, service metadata, and related technical artifacts
  • Identify, prioritize, and deploy detection mechanisms for command-and-control infrastructure, malware families, and threat groups of interest
  • Continuously evaluate and improve threat intelligence workflows, identifying opportunities to enhance automation, efficiency, and analytic precision
  • Stay up to date on evolving APT tradecraft by regularly reviewing technical publications, blogs, and intelligence from trusted sharing communities
  • Mentor colleagues on intrusion analysis tradecraft and threat intelligence best practices, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous development
  • Collaborate with geopolitical and regional analysis teams to support cross-functional research
  • Propose and evaluate new data sources and analytical methods to enhance or automate the intelligence cycle
  • Represent Insikt Group externally as a subject matter expert through customer briefings, media engagements, or public research dissemination
  • Collaborate with engineering and data science teams to ensure effective integration of relevant data and analytics into the Recorded Future platform
  • Support customer intelligence needs through Recorded Future’s Analyst-on-Demand service

What You’ll Bring (Required):

  • BA/BS or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Security, Security Studies, Intelligence, or a related field
  • Preferably 5+ years of experience in Information Security and/or Threat Intelligence
  • Demonstrated experience conducting technical threat analysis and research
  • In-depth knowledge of TCP/IP and other networking protocols and datasets relevant to intrusion and network infrastructure analysis
  • Demonstrated capability in identifying and tracking infrastructure through methods such as banner analysis and metadata correlation
  • Experience with static and dynamic malware analysis, including family attribution and variant clustering
  • Proficiency in scripting (Python preferred, or Go, C, C++, Java) and fluency with common CTI research tools such as Maltego, Jupyter Notebook, the Elastic Stack, and similar tools
  • Proven experience applying structured analytical techniques and intelligence methodologies to assess state-sponsored threat activity, including the intelligence cycle, intelligence writing best practices, and frameworks such as the Diamond Model
  • Familiarity with threat modeling and adversary tracking frameworks such as MITRE ATT&CK, the Cyber Kill Chain, and related models to support campaign clustering, detection development, and strategic reporting
  • Detailed understanding of existing APT groups’ past activities, TTPs, motivations, and targeting patterns
  • Experience with open-source intelligence-gathering tools and techniques
  • Experience working directly with customers, with strong written and verbal communication skills to clearly convey complex technical and non-technical concepts
  • Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills, including working with globally distributed team members

Highly Desirable Skills/Experience (not required):

  • MA/MS or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Security, or a related field
  • Experience writing network and endpoint detection signatures
  • Experience with Windows, iOS, Android, macOS, or malware analysis
  • Proficiency in a high-priority foreign language, with preference for Arabic, Chinese, Farsi, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, or Spanish

  • Establish and refine methods to track APT campaigns using network, intrusion, and malware analysis

  • Identify, prioritize, and deploy detection mechanisms for command-and-control infrastructure, malware families, and threat groups of interest
  • Continuously evaluate and improve threat intelligence workflows, identifying opportunities to enhance automation, efficiency, and analytic precision
  • Stay up to date on evolving APT tradecraft by regularly reviewing technical publications, blogs, and intelligence from trusted sharing communities

  • Collaborate with geopolitical and regional analysis teams to support cross-functional research

  • Represent Insikt Group externally as a subject matter expert through customer briefings, media engagements, or public research dissemination
  • Collaborate with engineering and data science teams to ensure effective integration of relevant data and analytics into the Recorded Future platform
  • Support customer intelligence needs through Recorded Future’s Analyst-on-Demand service

What You’ll Bring (Required):

  • BA/BS or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Security, Security Studies, Intelligence, or a related field
  • Preferably 5+ years of experience in Information Security and/or Threat Intelligence
  • Demonstrated experience conducting technical threat analysis and research
  • In-depth knowledge of TCP/IP and other networking protocols and datasets relevant to intrusion and network infrastructure analysis
  • Demonstrated capability in identifying and tracking infrastructure through methods such as banner analysis and metadata correlation
  • Experience with static and dynamic malware analysis, including family attribution and variant clustering
  • Proficiency in scripting (Python preferred, or Go, C, C++, Java) and fluency with common CTI research tools such as Maltego, Jupyter Notebook, the Elastic Stack, and similar tools
  • Proven experience applying structured analytical techniques and intelligence methodologies to assess state-sponsored threat activity, including the intelligence cycle, intelligence writing best practices, and frameworks such as the Diamond Model
  • Familiarity with threat modeling and adversary tracking frameworks such as MITRE ATT&CK, the Cyber Kill Chain, and related models to support campaign clustering, detection development, and strategic reporting
  • Detailed understanding of existing APT groups’ past activities, TTPs, motivations, and targeting patterns
  • Experience with open-source intelligence-gathering tools and techniques
  • Experience working directly with customers, with strong written and verbal communication skills to clearly convey complex technical and non-technical concepts
  • Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills, including working with globally distributed team members

  • MA/MS or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Security, or a related field
  • Experience writing network and endpoint detection signatures
  • Experience with Windows, iOS, Android, macOS, or malware analysis
  • Proficiency in a high-priority foreign language, with preference for Arabic, Chinese, Farsi, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, or Spanish

title: Software Engineer, Attack Surface Intelligence
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

Now part of Mastercard but still operating independently, Recorded Future is at the leading edge of not only cyber intelligence, but also providing intelligence data at the forefront of one of the largest global payment networks.


We are seeking a skilled and motivated Software Engineer to work on the development of our sophisticated Internet scanning platforms within the Attack Surface Intelligence group, on the Threat Research and Active Collection of Exposures (TRACE) team and Scan Infrastructure and Automation sub-team. The ideal candidate will have experience in large technical projects, serving as an individual contributor. This position requires great communication skills to coordinate with principal engineers, senior engineers, and DevOps teams for iterative development and deployment of updates.

What you’ll do:

  • Develop and optimize new and existing components of our scalable Internet scanning platform with a global reach.
  • Work on the development of automations for some of our more manual scan platform and operations tasks, and work with the Support Team to streamline manual tickets so that as we go forward we spend less time on managing our infrastructure and scan platform.
  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and deployment of new features and updates.
  • Regularly communicate project status, challenges, and insights to the principal engineer and your manager.
  • Participate in technical discussions and initiatives aimed at improving our scanning technologies and processes.

What you’ll bring:

  • At least 2+ years of experience in software engineering or automation, ideally in an Enterprise SaaS product, traditional engineering context (e.g. manufacturing, healthcare, finance, etc.), or a Cybersecurity/Computer Networking vendor.
  • Development experience in Python or Go. Additional familiarity with Rust, Elixir, and/or PHP is beneficial.
  • Familiarity with technologies such as message busses/queues (Kafka, RabbitMQ, SQS, etc.), containerization and orchestration platforms (Docker, Kubernetes, etc.), version control systems (Git, Github), and using CLI tools.
  • A built-in desire to monitor systems you build and maintain, build dashboards, view and analyze logs for alerting, and compile metrics for improving performance.
  • Familiarity with the TCP/IP protocol stack, including application of concepts from HTTP, DNS, WHOIS, and other artifacts needed for technical reconnaissance and discovery.
  • Solid understanding of software development principles, design patterns, and best practices.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Software Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent work/education experience.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under minimal supervision.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate technical concepts.
  • Strong English language skills are a must.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Ideal candidates will have done engineering work in a low-level, network-heavy application with a focus on high-volume traffic and availability.
  • Any Familiarity with working in or building on top of AWS, Azure, GCP, or other cloud-native services.
  • Any familiarity with cybersecurity principles and the unique challenges of developing cybersecurity products
  • Any familiarity with things like web crawling, API automation, portscanning, vulnerability scanning, or signature development
  • Experience building and deploying Internet scanning, web crawling, or similar platforms.
  • Any familiarity with enterprise security products related to Recorded Future’s offerings

title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

Job Description: Threat Intelligence Analyst – Geopolitical & Digital Risk Focus

The Role: The Research on Request team seeks an experienced analyst to produce consistently high-quality threat intelligence for a diverse client base. In addition to cyber-focused analysis, you will be expected to:

What You'll Do: 

  • Deliver finished intelligence that addresses client priority intelligence requirements across cyber, geopolitical, digital-risk and kinetic threat domains.
  • Engage with clients throughout the report lifecycle—scoping, delivery and follow-up support.
  • Develop streamlined, repeatable, or automated workflows to improve research and analysis.
  • Track and assess geopolitical developments in one or more of the following regions: Russia, China, Iran or North Korea.
  • Research the implications of the geopolitical developments on the cyber threat landscape.
  • Conduct open-source investigations on individuals to evaluate their digital risk exposure.
  • Identify, analyze and clearly describe kinetic threats where relevant to client environments.
  • Collaborate on projects across multiple research teams under tight deadlines.

What You'll Bring : 

  • Two to three years as a threat intelligence analyst or in a comparable role.
  • Demonstrated writing ability (assessed via a sample).
  • BA/BS or MA/MS in Computer Science, Information Security, International Relations, Political Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
  • Geopolitical expertise in at least one of: Russia, China, Iran or North Korea, with a track record of assessing state activity and regional dynamics.
  • Open-source investigation experience focused on individuals and their digital footprints to inform risk assessments.
  • Experience identifying and articulating kinetic threats (e.g., physical attacks, military actions) and their potential impact on clients.
  • Proven experience researching and analyzing threats across either multiple industries or multiple timeframes (e.g., weekly and quarterly).
  • Ability to translate complex technical and geopolitical concepts into clear written and verbal products.

Preferred Qualifications : 

  • Working knowledge of at least one non-English language relevant to regions with active or sophisticated cyber operations.
  • Documented experience leading or coordinating multi-source cyber or geopolitical investigations.
  • Familiarity with scripting languages such as Python, Ruby, JavaScript or C (hands-on scripting ideal but not mandatory).

description_text:

Role: Account Director

As an Account Director at Recorded Future, you will drive revenue growth by expanding relationships with existing customers and acquiring new business. What You'll Do:

Account Management & Development:

  • Manage and grow existing relationships with customers in your designated territory, ensuring long-term success and expansion.

  • Partner with internal teams (e.g., Customer Success) to ensure customers receive the value they expect.
  • Serve as the primary point of contact for customers, establishing trust and influence at all levels of the organization.

  • Prospect and acquire new clients aligning client’s cybersecurity needs with Recorded Future’s solutions.
  • Drive the full sales cycle from lead generation, solution demos, negotiations, and closing deals with new customers.

  • Collaborate with channel partners to expand your pipeline and increase market reach.

  • Develop and present compelling proposals, ensuring alignment with customer needs and objectives.
  • Utilize sales methodologies such as MEDDIC and Value-Based Selling to influence decision-makers and close complex deals.
  • Create and execute go-to-market strategies in collaboration with internal and external teams, aligning with both customer needs and business goals.
  • Track and update opportunities in Salesforce, providing accurate forecasts and ensuring timely progress toward closing.

What You'll Bring:

Experience & Industry Knowledge:

  • Experience in full sales cycle roles, with a focus on new business acquisition in the enterprise cybersecurity, SaaS, or information security sectors.

  • Deep understanding of the cybersecurity landscape, including knowledge of threat intelligence and security operations.
  • Experience working with security-focused channel partners, and an understanding of how to leverage these relationships to drive growth.

  • Consultative sales approach with strong communication skills to engage both technical and executive stakeholders.

title: Account Director, Thailand
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

Role: Account Director

As an Account Director at Recorded Future, you will drive revenue growth by expanding relationships with existing customers and acquiring new business. This role involves managing key accounts, identifying new opportunities, and working closely with internal teams and channel partners to deliver cybersecurity solutions to clients.

What You'll Do:

Account Management & Development:

  • Manage and grow existing relationships with customers in your designated territory, ensuring long-term success and expansion.
  • Identify new opportunities within the existing customer base, driving upgrades, cross-sells, and contract renewals at escalated ARR rates.
  • Partner with internal teams (e.g., Customer Success) to ensure customers receive the value they expect.
  • Serve as the primary point of contact for customers, establishing trust and influence at all levels of the organization.

New Business Acquisition:

  • Prospect and acquire new clients aligning client’s cybersecurity needs with Recorded Future’s solutions.
  • Drive the full sales cycle from lead generation, solution demos, negotiations, and closing deals with new customers.
  • Leverage market insights to position Recorded Future’s solutions, staying informed about industry trends and competitor offerings.
  • Collaborate with channel partners to expand your pipeline and increase market reach.

Sales Execution & Strategy:

  • Develop and present compelling proposals, ensuring alignment with customer needs and objectives.
  • Utilize sales methodologies such as MEDDIC and Value-Based Selling to influence decision-makers and close complex deals.
  • Create and execute go-to-market strategies in collaboration with internal and external teams, aligning with both customer needs and business goals.
  • Track and update opportunities in Salesforce, providing accurate forecasts and ensuring timely progress toward closing.

What You'll Bring:

Experience & Industry Knowledge:

  • Experience in full sales cycle roles, with a focus on new business acquisition in the enterprise cybersecurity, SaaS, or information security sectors.
  • Proven ability to grow revenue through both existing accounts and new business acquisition.
  • Deep understanding of the cybersecurity landscape, including knowledge of threat intelligence and security operations.
  • Experience working with security-focused channel partners, and an understanding of how to leverage these relationships to drive growth.

Skills & Abilities:

  • Consultative sales approach with strong communication skills to engage both technical and executive stakeholders.
  • Analytical and problem-solving abilities to uncover customer needs and present solutions effectively.
  • Negotiation expertise, with the ability to handle objections and close complex deals.
  • Self-motivated and results-driven, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and work independently in a fast-paced environment.

Tools & Requirements:

  • Proficiency in Salesforce, Google Suite, and a Mac environment.
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
  • Ability to travel up to 30% of the time.

You’ll own the full sales cycle, from prospecting to close, while building trusted relationships with senior stakeholders in cybersecurity, IT, and procurement. This is a high-impact, quota-carrying role ideal for a strategic, driven, and customer-obsessed sales leader.

Responsibilities:

New Business Acquisition

  • Identify and pursue net-new logo opportunities through outbound prospecting, referrals, and channel networks

Experience

title: Associate Software Engineer, AI & Analytics
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

We are looking for a curious software engineer with a strong interest in data analytics to join Recorded Future’s Analytics Team within the R&D organization. You will be joining a group of talented engineers, linguists, and data scientists who share a common interest in solving challenging data analytics tasks in large distributed systems with rich data. The team's responsibilities include developing AI solutions which interact with the Recorded Future Intelligence Graph and Platform. We strive to make our data as actionable and comprehensive as possible and have fun.

As a more junior engineer you will will get the chance to develop great software in a fast-moving environment close to our global clients and their needs. Together, we’ll improve our product to meet increasing demands while focusing on scalability and quality. You will also get a chance to experiment with new technology and explore what solutions are most suitable for solving real-world problems. You would join a dynamic team eager to take on new challenges and are passionate about what they do.

What you will be doing:

  • Use AI to help understand and pinpoint threats and empower our customers to prioritize and act quickly
  • Help develop AI Agents and explore emerging techniques using natural language to connect systems and solve problems in a safe and reliable manner
  • Measure and evaluate AI Agents and their ability to adapt to changing conditions
  • Work together with our product teams to understand and deliver AI based features
  • Be a part of a team on the forefront of how software systems may be built in the future
  • Access to the energy, velocity, and freedom of an entrepreneurial culture
  • Be proactive, go beyond expectations

What you will need:

  • Minimum a year of experience as a software engineer
  • Experience in generative AI or machine learning
  • General coding skills with high proficiency in Python
  • Knowledge of API development
  • Solid communication skills - natural language is a key skill
  • Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent education/work experience
  • Great energy and learning agility
  • Strong English skills are a must

Bonus points for:

  • Knowledge and interest in RAG systems, Agent frameworks.
  • Knowledge and interest in RabbitMQ, MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Docker, Kubernetes

title: Backend Software Engineer, Attack Surface Intelligence (Elixir)
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

Now part of Mastercard but still operating independently, Recorded Future is at the leading edge of not only cyber intelligence, but also providing intelligence data at the forefront of one of the largest global payment networks.

We are seeking a skilled Backend Engineer specializing in Elixir to join our Applications Team. This role focuses on developing and maintaining backend services that power our customer-facing applications, ensuring seamless interaction with our comprehensive scanning infrastructure. As a Backend Software Engineer, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to enhance product capabilities. You'll join a small team of highly skilled engineers, bring new knowledge, and have the opportunity to contribute to our growing culture of professionalism.

What You'll Do: 

  • Utilize Elixir to design and implement robust backend services supporting customer-facing applications
  • Deliver high-quality and maintainable code with reliable test coverage
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including frontend developers and infrastructure partners, to ensure integration with our scanning infrastructure
  • Regularly report on project progress and provide insights to senior engineers and management
  • Engage in technical discussions and bring forward ideas to refine backend processes and technologies

What You'll Bring: 

  • 2+ years of experience in software engineering, with experience in Enterprise SaaS or Cybersecurity/Networking environments.
  • Proficiency in Elixir or Erlang and general backend development.
  • Experience with AWS environments and container orchestration using Kubernetes.
  • Solid understanding of software development principles, design patterns, and best practices.
  • Familiarity with version control systems, including Git and Github.
  • Capability to monitor platforms efficiently, analyze performance, and apply necessary improvements.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.
  • Strong communication skills to convey technical concepts and collaborate effectively.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with Python and Scala to facilitate collaboration across different teams.
  • Proficient in communicating with ElasticSearch or similar data stores
  • Experience in developing backend systems for high-availability, customer-facing applications.
  • Knowledge of cybersecurity principles relevant to product development.
  • Understanding of cloud-native services, particularly in AWS.

You’ll be instrumental in designing and delivering solutions that address the most critical cybersecurity challenges faced by our clients. This hybrid role involves direct partner engagement, pre-sales engineering support, and strategic enablement—bridging the gap between product capability and market execution.

description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

As a Channel Sales Engineer, East, you will support our commercial enterprise customers across the Eastern U.S. by partnering with Channel Partners and internal Account Teams. You’ll help design and deliver solutions that address complex cybersecurity challenges across a broad range of industries. This role combines technical pre-sales support, partner enablement, and solution architecture to drive channel-led growth in the region.

You’ll lead technical evaluations, deliver tailored demos, and train partner teams—ensuring Recorded Future is positioned to win across key enterprise accounts. This role requires strong cybersecurity expertise, technical depth, and the ability to align with partner go-to-market motions.

What You’ll Do:

  • Partner with Channel Account Managers to support and enable East Coast commercial Channel Partners (VARs, MSSPs, integrators, and tech alliances).
  • Engage with partners and customers to gather technical requirements and provide solution guidance.
  • Lead product evaluations, proof-of-value efforts, and technical integration planning.
  • Design solutions that align with partner strategies and customer outcomes across sectors like financial services, healthcare, and manufacturing.
  • Deliver compelling demos and presentations tailored to enterprise buyer personas.
  • Train partner presales and services teams on Recorded Future’s platform, integrations, and use cases.
  • Promote technical adoption across threat intel, SOC, risk, and security leadership functions.
  • Address analytical and operational challenges in complex enterprise environments.
  • Collaborate with Product, Marketing, and Intelligence Services to optimize partner engagement and support.
  • Travel as needed across the Eastern U.S. (up to 50%).

Key Qualifications:

  • 3+ years in a Pre-Sales Engineering, Solutions Architect, or Consulting role—cybersecurity or threat intelligence preferred.
  • Experience working with or enabling commercial Channel Partners.
  • Strong knowledge of enterprise security ecosystems and buying cycles.
  • Familiarity with:
    • SIEM
    • DFIR
    • Threat Intelligence
    • Vulnerability Management
    • Security Operations
    • APIs and integrations
  • Proven ability to deliver demos, run POCs, and enable technical sales teams.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills across technical and business audiences.
  • Able to build credibility with partner engineers, CISOs, and cross-functional stakeholders.
  • Self-motivated, adaptable, and thrives in a high-performance environment.

title: Channel Sales Engineer, Public Sector
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

As a Channel Sales Engineer, Public Sector, you will support our U.S. Public Sector customers by partnering with Federal and State-focused Channel Partners and internal Account Teams. You’ll help architect and deliver mission-aligned solutions that solve complex cybersecurity challenges across government environments. This role blends partner-facing technical enablement, pre-sales support, and strategic collaboration to accelerate go-to-market success in the Public Sector.

You’ll lead technical evaluations, deliver tailored demonstrations, and train partner teams—ensuring alignment between Recorded Future’s capabilities and agency-specific needs. This role requires deep cybersecurity knowledge, technical acumen, and experience navigating public sector procurement and compliance landscapes.

  • Train partner presales and delivery teams on Recorded Future’s platform and integrations.
  • Promote technical adoption across threat intelligence, SOC, and mission support teams.
  • Solve analytical, operational, and integration challenges in complex government environments.

  • Travel as required within the U.S. (up to 50%).

  • 3+ years in a Pre-Sales Engineering, Solutions Architect, or Consulting role—cybersecurity or threat intel experience strongly preferred.

title: Customer Success Manager, Japan
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

Customer Success Manager, Intelligence Services 

* Japanese follows English (英語の後に日本語が続きます）

Who you’ll work with

As a Customer Success Manager, you will be joining a fast-paced, high-growth team delivering innovative security solutions that protect our clients. You will be part of an incredible customer success team with a rapidly growing client portfolio, ensuring our users get the most value out of our products and services. Don’t miss your opportunity to become a Futurist! 

What you’ll do

As a Customer Success Manager, you will:

  • Be responsible for a portfolio of cross-industry corporate, commercial, and enterprise clients. 
  • Execute our client engagement strategy to deliver positive outcomes for clients and power account renewals and upsell. 
  • Identify and assess risk factors to accounts and orchestrate interventions.
  • Work closely across the Intelligence Services team and with adjacent teams — Onboarding, Training, Support, Operations — to construct and scale solutions that nurture our relationships with clients. 
  • Learn our platform, become fluent in cybersecurity topics, and build familiarity with the functional areas (SOC, IR, Vulnerability Management, GRC) where we deliver value. 
  • Manage the customer journey and maximize our value to our users.
  • Regularly capture, analyze, and share the voice of the customer regarding their experience with Recorded Future.

What you’ll bring

  • Ability to work from our Tokyo office
  • Native level Japanese and Conversational English
  • Experience designing and executing communications and/or customer success programs
  • A background in delivering client-focused outcomes
  • Strong presentation and facilitation skills
  • Strong program management abilities
  • The ability to gather and understand the client’s needs
  • A positive, collaborative, and energetic style with a drive to make an impact

Additional Skills (preferred but not required):

  • 3 years of SaaS experience, including subject matter expertise in commercial/enterprise customer communications
  • Experience with Salesforce.com, Gainsight a plus

概要：

カスタマーサクセスマネージャーとして、お客様を保護する革新的なセキュリティソリューションを提供する急成長中のチームに参加していただきます。急速に成長する顧客ポートフォリオを持つ素晴らしいカスタマーサクセスチームの一員となり、当社の製品とサービスからユーザーが最大限の価値を得られるようにします。レコーデッド・フューチャーの一員 (Futurist) になるこの機会をぜひご活用ください。

職務内容：

カスタマーサクセスマネージャーとして、次のことを行います：

  • 複数の業界にまたがるお客様を担当
  • 戦略的なお客様とのコミュニケーションにより、ポジティブな結果をもたらし、契約更新とアップセルを促進する
  • お客様のリスク要因を特定および評価し、解決の支援をおこなう
  • インテリジェンス・サービス・チーム全体、およびオンボーディング、トレーニング、サポート、オペレーションといった関連するチームと密に連携し、お客様との関係を深めるソリューションを構築・拡張をおこなう
  • 当社のプラットフォームを学び、サイバーセキュリティのトピックを習熟し、当社が価値を提供する機能領域（SOC、IR、脆弱性管理、GRC）についてよく理解する。
  • カスタマージャーニー（お客様の行動プロセス）を管理し、ユーザーに対する当社の価値を最大化する
  • カスタマーエクスペリエンスに関するお客様の声を定期的に収集、分析、共有する

必要な経験・知識：

  • 東京オフィスでの勤務が可能な方
  • 言語：日本語（流暢〜母国語レベル）および英語（会話レベル）
  • コミュニケーションおよび/またはカスタマーサクセスプログラムの計画と実施の経験
  • 顧客重視の成果を提供した経験
  • プレゼンテーションとファシリテーションのスキル
  • プログラム管理能力
  • お客様のニーズを収集し理解する能力
  • 積極的、協調的、精力的に、インパクトを与える意欲のある方

その他のスキル (必須ではないが望ましい)：

  • 3年以上のSaaS経験（顧客とのコミュニケーションに関する専門知識を含む）
  • Salesforce.com、Gainsightの経験

title: Director, Corporate Communications
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

We’re looking for a strategic, media-savvy communicator to lead global PR and communications at Recorded Future. In this role, you’ll shape how the world sees us — from product launches and research to executive visibility and corporate storytelling — all in the fast-moving world of cyber and geopolitical threats. You’ll own the full communications lifecycle: crafting messaging, managing media relationships, guiding crisis responses, and driving thought leadership. You’ll work closely with our CEO, exec team, researchers, product, legal, and marketing — and lead the partnership with our external PR agency to bring it all together.

What You’ll Do as Director, Corporate Communications:

  • Own the global communications strategy across business, tech, cybersecurity, and policy press
  • Drive high-impact announcements, thought leadership, and corporate storytelling
  • Develop narratives that connect product, corporate, and brand stories across all channels
  • Partner with executives, research, and product teams to amplify insights, launches, partnerships, and milestones
  • Prepare executives for media interviews, speaking engagements, and major industry events
  • Manage PR agency relationships, analyst connections, and press contacts to secure standout coverage
  • Secure tier-1 media placements in top business, technology, and cybersecurity outlets
  • Lead media training, message development, and briefing prep for senior leaders
  • Navigate crisis communications with confidence, maintaining brand trust and readiness
  • Maintain and evolve crisis communications playbooks for security incidents and reputational risks
  • Collaborate across marketing, HR, and legal to ensure unified messaging and protect reputation
  • Partner with HR to elevate the employer brand, support recruitment marketing, and showcase company culture
  • Monitor market sentiment, industry trends, and competitive narratives to identify opportunities and mitigate risks

What You’ll Bring as The Director, Corporate Communications:

  • 10+ years in communications, PR, or corporate affairs, ideally in cybersecurity, enterprise tech, or threat intelligence
  • Proven record securing tier-1 media coverage and building strong journalist and analyst relationships
  • Expertise in narrative development, executive communications, and thought leadership
  • Experience in crisis communications and advising senior leadership during high-stakes moments
  • Exceptional writing skills to translate complex cybersecurity topics into clear, compelling stories
  • Highly organized, detail-oriented, and effective under tight deadlines
  • Skilled at managing agencies, coordinating cross-functional partners, and balancing multiple initiatives
  • Familiarity with major industry events (e.g., RSA, Black Hat) and PR tools (e.g., MuckRack, PR Newswire)
  • Knowledge of security regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) a plus

title: Director GTM Analytics and Planning
description_text:
With 1,000 intelligence professionals, over $300M in sales, and serving over 1,900 clients worldwide, Recorded Future is the world’s most advanced, and largest, intelligence company!

We are seeking a strategic and visionary Director of GTM Analytics & Planning to lead the development and execution of our GTM analytics strategy. This role is pivotal in accelerating revenue growth, optimizing GTM performance, and empowering cross-functional stakeholders with actionable insights. You will develop a high-performing analytics team and partner with Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Corporate Strategy and Finance to define performance metrics and guide strategic initiatives.

As a senior leader within Revenue Operations, your insights will power decision-making at the highest levels, influence how we grow and retain customers, and ensure alignment across our GTM ecosystem. If you are passionate about transforming data into strategy and thrive in a high-impact, fast-paced environment, we’d love to hear from you.

What You’ll Do: 

Strategic Leadership & Planning

  • Lead the annual GTM planning process in partnership with Sales, Marketing, Finance, and Corporate Strategy.
  • Build business cases for growth initiatives (e.g., segment expansion, territory & quota design, headcount allocation).
  • Define, standardize, and evolve GTM KPIs; maintain a centralized performance metrics framework.

Analytics & Reporting

  • Architect and operationalize a scalable analytics framework to evaluate GTM performance, market trends, and customer behavior.
  • Manage the design, development, and enhancement of GTM dashboards, reports, and self-service BI tools.
  • Run the CRO reporting cadence, delivering timely & actionable insights aligned with business goals.
  • Own the CRO forecasting operating rhythm to ensure predictable results.

Team & Stakeholder Management

  • Build and mentor a team of analysts and revenue operations business partners across global locations.
  • Act as a strategic partner to Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Finance and Corporate Strategy leaders.
  • Foster a culture of data-driven decision-making throughout the GTM organization.

Data Governance & Infrastructure

  • Ensure data accuracy, integrity, integration and availability across all GTM systems and analytics environments.
  • Develop and implement best practices for data governance, analytics methodology, and reporting.

Innovation & Enablement

  • Champion the adoption of advanced analytics tools and visualization platforms.
  • Lead the design of a scalable self-service analytics environment to empower non-technical users.
  • Present data-driven narratives to executive stakeholders, influencing top-level strategy.

What You’ll Bring

  • Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s degree in Analytics, Business, Economics, or related field strongly preferred.
  • 7–10+ years of experience in analytics, revenue operations, business intelligence, or strategic planning roles, ideally within high-growth B2B or SaaS environments.
  • Proven experience leading cross-functional analytics teams and building analytics strategies that directly impact revenue growth.
  • Deep understanding of GTM analytics, including sales funnel analysis, marketing attribution, pipeline health, and customer retention metrics.
  • Strong knowledge of SaaS-based territory and quota management processes and sales compensation structures.
  • Technical proficiency in SQL, Excel, and one or more scripting languages (Python/R); advanced experience with BI and data visualization tools (e.g., Domo, Clari, Tableau).
  • Familiarity with CRM, marketing automation, and customer success platforms (e.g., Salesforce, Marketo, Gainsight).
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to distill complex analytics into clear business recommendations.
  • Strategic thinker with a track record of influencing senior stakeholders and aligning analytics with organizational goals.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience managing analytics and forecasting for Revenue Operations or GTM Strategy in SaaS companies.
  • Background in consulting, finance, equity research, or strategic planning is highly valued.
  • Expertise in business modeling, scenario analysis, and balanced scorecard development.

Demonstrated success in driving adoption of analytics tools and establishing data-driven cultures.

The base salary range for this full-time position is $184,000 - $220,000  Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by state, work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. This position may be eligible for incentive compensation, equity, and medical, dental, vision, life insurance and 401K.
